events.title: Constantine I declares Sunday as a day of rest
events.description: Roman Emperor Constantine I decreed that Sunday would be a day of rest throughout the Roman Empire, a significant move in the spread of Christianity.
events.significance: This decree helped establish Christian practices and influenced the Western tradition of observing Sunday as a day off from work.

events.title: Alexander Graham Bell makes the first successful telephone call
events.description: Alexander Graham Bell successfully called his assistant, saying, 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you,' marking the first intelligible speech transmitted over the telephone.
events.significance: This event marked the birth of modern telecommunication, revolutionizing global communication systems.

events.title: Bloody Sunday in Selma, Alabama
events.description: Civil rights marchers attempting to cross the Edmund Pettus Bridge were brutally attacked by state troopers, an event that came to be known as 'Bloody Sunday'.
events.significance: The violent crackdown drew national attention to the civil rights movement, leading to the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

events.title: Ghana gains independence from Britain
events.description: Ghana became the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence from colonial rule on March 7, 1957.
events.significance: This event marked a major milestone in decolonization in Africa and inspired independence movements across the continent.
